intro: Najas marina subsp. marina, commonly known as the narrowleaf watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, whorled leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow, slow-moving waters and plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Its rapid growth can sometimes lead to dense vegetation that affects water flow and light penetration.
